title-group.article-title: A Study of Direct Injection Diesel Engine Fueled with Hydrogen

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2004 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: In this study, characteristics of the development and auto-ignition/combustion of hydrogen jets were investigated in a constant-volume vessel. The authors focused on the effects of the jet developing process and thermodynamic states of the ambient gas on autoignition delays of hydrogen jets. The results show that the ambient gas temperature and nozzle-hole diameter are significantly effective parameters. By contrast, it is clarified that the ambient gas oxygen concentration has a weak effect on the auto-ignition/combustion of hydrogen jets. Consequently, it is supposed that the mixture formation process is capable of improving the autoignition/combustion of hydrogen jets.
